column4: guys, i really like to get to learn linux, i heard ubuntu is a fine first choice
and will it run on my 333 mhz 192 ram?
yeah, but it will be slow
you all say different things, i mean, gnome is the most fancy one
and i like to keep it fancy ;)
but you all believe gnome will run slow on it?
and kde is faster than gnome?
i believe the default ubuntu install will run slw on it. im sure there are many ways to increase the performance on a 333mhz box
ah , can one choose among these when installing?
i have no clue how to tweak linux so i hoped it would run pretty ok from the start
does the live cd give a decent impression of ubuntu?
it will run, and you will be able to use it. but a faster processor and more ram would be needed to get good performance
if you dont mind waiting a split second for dropdown menus and cmboboxes to appear then you wont have a problem
damn, win xp runs fine, i thought ubuntu would run even faster
really? i've downlaoded the live cd, gonna burn it in the morning and try it out
every machine is different though. you should probably just try it out and see how it works before you start making choices
